title: HUNTR/X’s ‘Golden,’ From ‘KPop Demon Hunters,’ Shines With 14th Week Atop Global Charts
summary: The song continues at No. 1 on both the Global 200 and Global Excl. U.S.
body: HUNTR/X remains triumphant as “Golden,” from Netflix’s record-breaking animated movie KPop Demon Hunters , leads the Billboard Global 200 and Billboard Global Excl. U.S. charts for a 14th week each. In July, the song became the first No. 1 on each survey for the act, whose music is voiced by EJAE, Audrey Nuna and REI AMI. Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ Rules Hot 100 for Fourth Week, Kehlani Claims First Top 10 Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ Spends First Month at No. 1 on Billboard 200 ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Hit ‘Golden’ Breaks Longstanding U.K. Chart Record With 9th Week at No. 1 Plus, LE SSERAFIM and j-hope , of BTS, serve up a top 10 debut on both charts with “Spaghetti.” The Billboard Global 200 and Global Excl. U.S. charts rank songs based on streaming and sales activity culled from more than 200 territories around the world, as compiled by Luminate. The Global 200 is inclusive of worldwide data and the Global Excl. U.S. chart comprises data from territories excluding the United States. Chart ranks are based on a weighted formula incorporating official-only streams on both subscription and ad-supported tiers of audio …
